snippet: Vladimir Strzhalkovsky, chief executive of Norilsk Nickel and an ally of President Vladimir Putin, stepped down as part of the settlement of a shareholder dispute.
abstract: Norilsk Nickel mining company agrees to pay Vladimir Strzhalkovsky $100 million to step down as chief executive after only four years, biggest golden parachute payout in Russian history.
lead_paragraph: Vladimir Strzhalkovsky, chief executive of Norilsk Nickel and an ally of President Vladimir Putin, stepped down as part of the settlement of a shareholder dispute.

headline.seo: Norilsk Nickel Pays Strzhalkovsky $100 Million Severance
headline.main: Mining Executive Receives Payout of $100 Million, Russia’s Largest Ever
headline.print_headline: Mining Executive Receives Payout Of $100 Million, Russia’s Largest Ever
